qas.question: Which specific mammal is the largest today?
Which four legged mammal is considered to be the smartest?
About how small is the average bumble bee bat?
What do the largest group of mammals, elephants, have that helps the fetus during gestation?
How small is the average fetus?

plausible_answers.text: life at sea, in the air, in trees, or on two legs

qas.question: What are some fetuses adapted for?
What is another name for a large elephant?

plausible_answers.text: enables feeding the fetus during gestation

qas.question: What does a placenta help bumblebee bats do?

context: Mammals include the largest animals on the planet, the <b7_0>rorquals<b7_0/> and other large whales, as well as some of the most intelligent, such as <a2_0>elephants<a2_0/>, primates, including humans, and cetaceans. The basic body type is a four-legged land-borne animal, but some mammals are adapted for <b6_0>life at sea, in the air, in trees, or on two legs<b6_0/>. The largest group of mammals, the placentals, have <b4_0>a placenta<b4_0/>, which <b8_0>enables feeding the fetus during gestation<b8_0/>. Mammals range in size from the <a3_0><b5_0>30–40 mm (1.2–1.6 in)<b5_0/><a3_0/> <a1_0>bumblebee bat<a1_0/> to the 33-meter (108 ft) <a0_0>blue whale<a0_0/>.
